conclusion: To determine whether the accelerations of objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing, we need to analyze the slopes of the velocity-time graphs (v-t graphs) for both objects during the time interval from 0 to t1.
The red line represents the tangent line of different points on the v-t graphs for objects A and B.
We need to find the points where the red line intersects the v-t graphs.
The red line intersects the v-t graph at point A for object A.

premise: The slope of the tangent line at point A is the derivative of the velocity at that point.
conclusion: The derivative of the velocity at point A is the acceleration of object A.
The red line intersects the v-t graph at point B for object B.

premise: The slope of the tangent line at point B is the derivative of the velocity at that point.
conclusion: The derivative of the velocity at point B is the acceleration of object B.

premise: If the slope of the tangent line is positive, the acceleration is increasing.
conclusion: The slope of the tangent line at point A is positive.

premise: If the slope of the tangent line is negative, the acceleration is decreasing.
conclusion: The slope of the tangent line at point B is negative.

premise: The slope of the tangent line at point B is negative.
conclusion: The acceleration of object B is decreasing.

premise: The slope of the tangent line at point A is positive and the slope at point B is negative.
conclusion: Therefore, the accelerations of both objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing.
